title: How to Allow Camera Access on Snapchat

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. The app icon is gray with a gear icon inside.

steps.title: Tap on Privacy.
steps.content: Tap on Privacy . This is located next to a blue icon with a hand inside. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Camera.
steps.content: Tap on Camera . This is located next to a gray icon with a camera inside.

steps.title: Tap the Snapchat switch.
steps.content: Tap the Snapchat switch. If camera access isn’t turned on for Snapchat, the toggle switch will be gray. Simply tap on it to allow access, and the switch will turn green. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Snapchat and take a photo or video.
steps.content: Open Snapchat and take a photo or video. Now that you’ve turned the camera on for Snapchat, you should be able to take a photo or video.

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings. This is a gray or blue icon shaped like a gear, and you'll find it in your app list. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Apps.
steps.content: Tap on Apps . This is located near the top of your screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Snapchat.
steps.content: Tap on Snapchat . Scroll until you see this button next to the Snapchat app icon. If you don't see Snapchat, tap All Apps first.

steps.title: Tap on Permissions.
steps.content: Tap on Permissions . This is located near the middle of the screen.

steps.title: Tap on Camera.
steps.content: Tap on Camera . This is located next to a camera icon.

steps.title: Tap on Allow only while using the app.
steps.content: Tap on Allow only while using the app . This will now grant camera access to Snapchat. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open Snapchat and take a photo or video.
steps.content: Open Snapchat and take a photo or video. Now that you’ve turned the camera on for Snapchat, you should be able to take a photo or video.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. This is an alternative if the first methods didn’t work for you. First just open the Snapchat app–the icon is yellow with a white ghost inside.

steps.title: Tap on your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap on your profile picture. This is in the top left corner. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Settings.
steps.content: Tap on Settings . This is the gear icon located in the top right corner. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Manage.
steps.content: Tap on Manage . Scroll down until you find this button underneath “Additional Services.” [8] X Research source You can skip this step if you are using an Android. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Permissions.
steps.content: Tap on Permissions . The text should appear red if you have not granted camera access yet. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Camera.
steps.content: Tap on Camera . You should see the text, “Tap to enable,” next to this if you haven’t granted camera access yet. You have now successfully allowed camera access to Snapchat.

steps.title: Tap on the back arrow four times.
steps.content: Tap on the back arrow four times. This is in the top left corner.

steps.title: Tap on the camera icon.
steps.content: Tap on the camera icon. This is located at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Take a photo or video.
steps.content: Take a photo or video. Now that you’ve turned the camera on for Snapchat, you should be able to take a photo or video.
